intro: Chamaecrista dussii, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to arid landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
